overview: Madurai, the third‑largest city of Tamil Nadu, is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world. Situated on the banks of the Vaigai River, it is famed for its historic temples—especially the Meenakshi Amman Temple—its rich Pandyan heritage, and vibrant festivals such as Chithirai and Jallikattu.
approximateDailyBudgetINR: ₹1,500–₹2,000 (budget accommodation, meals, local transport and entry fees)
travelTips: Arrive via Madurai Airport (IXM) or Madurai Junction railway station; both are well connected to major Indian cities.
From the airport, take bus 10A to Periyar bus stand or hire a prepaid taxi.
Use state‑run and private buses, auto‑rickshaws (negotiate fares), or shared cabs for intra‑city travel.
Book budget hotels or guesthouses near the city centre for easy access to attractions.
Carry cash in INR for small purchases and transport; many places accept only cash.
